page.title: 13Population in The Maylands
page.content: The 1981 census showed a total of 2464 but this has been estimated to have increased to{2746 by 1985.}250 houses are being built in Mayland alone with an estimated increase in population of 1000 in ten years.{Social classes}for the area are:- Class 1 210 Class 2 570 Class 3 270 non manual Class 3 890 manual Class 4 160 Class 5 80 Out of 792 households{747 are owner {occupied.}The emphasis is on space with only one household having more than 1.5 persons per room and most with one or less. In 1981 there were {247 OAP'S.}It is doubtful if this has increased much. It is essentially a young community. There were 733 children aged 15 or under.
